metadata.title: CVE-2018-15822 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The flv_write_packet function in libavformat/flvenc.c in FFmpeg through 2.8does not check for an empty audio packet, leading to an assertion failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15822` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.3-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.3-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.0.3-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.0.3-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0.3-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.0.3-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.0.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.3-1').
